text: It was after my bedtime in this timezone. :man-shrugging::skin-tone-2:

elements.text: It was after my bedtime in this timezone.

text: It was all set to go, but everything at work caught fire today and I couldn't :pensive:

elements.text: It was all set to go, but everything at work caught fire today and I couldn't

text: Quick question: I'm thinking of joining Mastodon.  Anyone here knows an instance relating to FoC, with a mix of techy and artsy vibes?  I'm thinking of something like Merveilles, for example

elements.text: Quick question: I'm thinking of joining Mastodon.  Anyone here knows an instance relating to FoC, with a mix of techy and artsy vibes?  I'm thinking of something like Merveilles, for example

text: I'm at <https://vis.social> but the nice thing about the fediverse is that picking the instance doesn't limit you (other than the benefit of the local timeline aligning with your interests)

attachments.title: vis.social
attachments.text: vis.social is an open social platform for creative people, especially anyone in sciArt, data, visualization, creative coding, and related arts and research. English is the common language of the instance.

elements.text: I'm at
but the nice thing about the fediverse is that picking the instance doesn't limit you (other than the benefit of the local timeline aligning with your interests)

text: I've tried applying to <https://merveilles.town> in the past, but my application was ignored / silently rejected... :sweat: <@UCUSW7WVD> has an account there, I wonder if they know any secrets required to get one...

attachments.title: Merveilles
attachments.text: Merveilles is a community project aimed at the establishment of new ways of speaking, seeing and organizing information — A culture that seeks augmentation through the arts of engineering and design. A warm welcome to any like-minded people who feel these ideals resonate with them.

elements.text: I've tried applying to
in the past, but my application was ignored / silently rejected...
has an account there, I wonder if they know any secrets required to get one...

text: I'm on Merveilles; there are some good discussions on there, it is worth trying again.  They have rules about your avatar (has to be black and white).  I didn't know about vis.social; joining!

elements.text: I'm on Merveilles; there are some good discussions on there, it is worth trying again.  They have rules about your avatar (has to be black and white).  I didn't know about vis.social; joining!

text: Looks like Merveilles has changed to explicitly invite only, as I no longer see the "request account" path... I wonder if any existing users can invite people, or if it's admin only...

elements.text: Looks like Merveilles has changed to explicitly invite only, as I no longer see the "request account" path... I wonder if any existing users can invite people, or if it's admin only...

text:
I recently requested one from the admins. Hasn't actually gotten used yet, and it feels like a big enough deal that I'm not feeling comfortable asking immediately for another :sweat_smile:

<@UUQ2EQW21> how did you end up there? I actually got invited without asking, and by then I'd been following enough people from there that it felt worth uprooting myself.

<@UML4ZEKDK>, I think a link to a demo would go a long way here. Looking at <https://github.com/merveilles/The-Town#common-hashtags|https://github.com/merveilles/The-Town#common-hashtags> they don't seem to care about academic writing..

attachments.title: merveilles/The-Town
attachments.text: Resources for the Merveilles Town instance. Contribute to merveilles/The-Town development by creating an account on GitHub.

elements.text: I recently requested one from the admins. Hasn't actually gotten used yet, and it feels like a big enough deal that I'm not feeling comfortable asking immediately for another
how did you end up there? I actually got invited without asking, and by then I'd been following enough people from there that it felt worth uprooting myself.
, I think a link to a demo would go a long way here. Looking at
https://github.com/merveilles/The-Town#common-hashtags
they don't seem to care about academic writing..

text: Hmm, I guess I find it odd to be checking so closely things like demos vs. papers, but of course if that's what they want... Perhaps better for me to just ignore it then, there are many other instances. Mostly I just noticed that many of the people I follow on Twitter are on Merveilles, so the local timeline seemed like it would be of interest.

text: Yeah exactly same as you, <@UML4ZEKDK>.  But I also get that ppl prefer to keep their instance small, which is why I was looking for an alternative.  vis.social seems pretty nice, although quite big :thinking_face:

elements.text: Yeah exactly same as you,

text: Extremely valid tbh

text: I would happily contribute to the server costs... :shrug:

text:
And yes, the local timeline is absolutely the draw here.

Interestingly, I've seen people called out for "spamming the local timeline." So maybe that's the top reason for the gate-keeping?

elements.text:

text: I don't remember how I got on there, it was quite a long time ago; probably because I was chatting with Devine a bit....

elements.text: I don't remember how I got on there, it was quite a long time ago; probably because I was chatting with Devine a bit....

text: Might be worth spinning up a new instance with similar interests?

elements.text: Might be worth spinning up a new instance with similar interests?

text:
> people called out for "spamming the local timeline."
Seems like a lot of strange social rules to navigate then, not sure I really want to deal with that... :confused:

elements.text: people called out for "spamming the local timeline."
Seems like a lot of strange social rules to navigate then, not sure I really want to deal with that...

text:
Yeah, it's a bit like living in a co-op.

Perhaps I overstated when I said "called out." Everyone's very nice.

elements.text:

text: I'm kind of a non-communal loner type, so it's been quite surprising/illuminating that the restrictions go so well with the grain of what I'm willing to put up with.

elements.text: I'm kind of a non-communal loner type, so it's been quite surprising/illuminating that the restrictions go so well with the grain of what I'm willing to put up with.

text: Yeah the few times I've checked the public timeline there, it seemed like a welcoming and inspiring place

elements.text: Yeah the few times I've checked the public timeline there, it seemed like a welcoming and inspiring place

text: I wonder what's needed to build an online space like that?

elements.text: I wonder what's needed to build an online space like that?

text: Partly it is driven by Devine's work; he often sets the tone too.

elements.text: Partly it is driven by Devine's work; he often sets the tone too.

text: Yeah that makes a lot of sense

text: I'd have love to attend if it had been at a time more compatible with my timezone. Do you know if there will be a recording put on line?
